messageBody:
Sounds like you're suggesting a "reset" button, so add one... :)

public class MySingleton {
...
public static void reset() {
instance = null; // ...or whatever else you need to do.
}
...
}

JBR.

clarkware wrote:

> --- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> > >
> > Depending on the implementation of the singleton you're attempting
> to test, it
> > may be possible to obtain a reference to its sole instance (or
> instances) and
> > assign it a null value. If the implementation uses lazy
> initialization, this
> > may trigger reinitialization on the next invocation of
> getInstance().
> >
>
> Correction. Of course the following will not work:
>
> Object o = getInstance(...);
> o = null;
>
> The reference to 'o' is a copy, so assigning it 'null' will have no
> effect on the singleton. The only way to assign a 'null' value is
> through a setter on the singleton itself.
>
> Mike
